item_prototype.name: Collisions on interface $1
item_prototype.description: The number of output collisions detected on this interface

item_prototype.name: CRC packets on interface $1
item_prototype.description: Number of input packets which had cyclic redundancy checksum errors.

item_prototype.name: Giants packets on interface $1
item_prototype.description: Number of input packets which were larger then the physical media permitted.

item_prototype.name: Ignored packets on interface $1
item_prototype.description: Number of input packets which were simply ignored by this interface.

item_prototype.name: Length of the output packet queue for interface $1
Misaligned packets on interface $1
item_prototype.description: Number of input packet which were misaligned.

item_prototype.name: Overruns packets on interface $1
item_prototype.description: Count of input which arrived too quickly for the to hardware receive.

item_prototype.name: Runts packets on interface $1
item_prototype.description: Number of packets input which were smaller then the allowable physical media permitted

item_prototype.name: Uni-Direction link configuration for interface $1
item_prototype.description: "Indicates the operational mode of Uni Direction Link Detection Protocol Feature on this interface."

item_prototype.name: Uni-Direction link status for interface $1
item_prototype.description: "This mib object contains the following values, which has the meaning as: 'shutdown' - An Uni-Direction link has been detected and the port has been disabled. 'indeterminant' - Uni-Direction Link Detection protocol has not collected enough information to determine if the link is bi directional or not. 'biDirectional' - A bi directional link has been detected. 'notApplicable' - Uni-Direction Link Detection Protocol is disabled."

trigger_prototype.name: An Uni-Direction link has been detected of interface {#SNMPVALUE}
Incoming use on interface {#SNMPVALUE} exceed 80% for the last 5 minutes
Operational status was changed on interface {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger for interface ifAlias that didn't match user macro {$INT_REGEX}

trigger_prototype.name: Operational status was changed on interface {#SNMPVALUE}
trigger_prototype.description: Trigger for interface ifAlias that match user macro {$INT_REGEX}

trigger_prototype.name: Ouput packets queue for {#SNMPVALUE} is not empty
Outgoing use on interface {#SNMPVALUE} exceed 80% for the last 5 minutes
Unable to determine Uni-Direction link status of interface {#SNMPVALUE}

graph_prototype.name: Interface {#SNMPVALUE} - Length of the output packets queue
